sentences.sContent: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.sCn: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.sContent: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.sCn: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

sentences.sContent: ...is the way reality can modify idealistic views...
...Piaget argued that attaining and accepting a vocation is one of the best ways to modify idealized views and to mature...
...Other studies show that simply providing the facility for people to compare their energy use with the local average is enough to cause them to modify their behavior...
...He and his wife were able to modify the mortgage on their four-bedroom house in Medford...

remMethod.val: mod ＋ ify(使…) → 使…改变方式 → 修改

words.tran: [助剂] 改性剂；[语] 修饰语；修正的人

trans.tranCn: 更改， 修改； 修饰
trans.tranOther: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective
